meanings.definition: To pull or draw along after itself or oneself
meanings.sent1: The strong wind can entrainer leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: The dog tried to entrainer its owner towards the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to entrainer the cat on a chase.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter seemed to entrainer everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The catchy tune was able to entrainer people to start dancing.

meanings.definition: To exercise or develop the muscles by means of a trainer
meanings.sent1: She would entrainer her arms with the dumbbells at the gym.
meanings.sent2: The athletes entrainer their bodies regularly to stay fit.
meanings.sent3: The fitness instructor would entrainer the class with challenging workouts.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to entrainer his muscles paid off during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The personal trainer helped her entrainer her muscles effectively.

meanings.definition: To put into motion or action
meanings.sent1: The key turned easily, entrainer the engine to start.
meanings.sent2: The applause from the audience entrainer the performer to take a bow.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies would always entrainer him to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech was able to entrainer the crowd to take action.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock entrainer her to get out of bed and start the day.
